intro: Stimoryne integrifolia subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western broadleaf stimoryne, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in riparian habitats. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its potential medicinal uses in traditional practices.
